law.catch_line: Statutes to be written in nontechnical language.
law.text: All bills introduced in the General Assembly after June 17, 1978, shall be written in nontechnical language and in a clear and coherent manner using words with common and everyday meanings. Enactment of a bill by the General Assembly shall be a conclusive presumption that such bill conforms to this section.
law.history: Created 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 241, sec. 1, effective June 17, 1978.
